intro: Acetosella wrightii, commonly known as Wright's sorrel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland areas. The plant features trifoliate leaves with reddish veins and produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. It is native to the eastern United States and is often found in the understory of forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
